lines.text: They won't pay ten cents to see one of my movies, but passing in a gondola, they love it.

I know I've got the kind of personality where when I'm here in Europe I miss New York, and when I'm in New York I miss Europe. I just don't want to be where I am at any given moment. I would rather be somewhere else. There's no way to beat that problem, because no matter where you are. It's chronic dissatisfaction. Anhedonia.
There's nothing there between you and the pure feeling of playing. There's no cerebral part to it.
I'm appropriately animate for a human being in the context in which I exist.
The Europeans like pictures that drone on, and I'm good at making pictures that drone on.
This is Soon-Yi Previn, the notorious Soon-Yi Previn.
